net.antidot.api.search
Class Query

java.lang.Object
  net.antidot.api.search.Query

public class Query
extends java.lang.Object

Immutable query object.

Manages all parameters necessary to query Antidot search engine and generate new query links.

All set/add methods copy current query object, then the copy is updated and finally is returned as the result of the methods.

hasPage

public boolean hasPage()
Checks whether specific page has been defined.

Default page number is 1 which is the default result page for Antidot search engine.

Returns:
true when specific page has been defined, false otherwise.

setPage

public Query setPage(long pageNo)
Defines new page number.

Page number should be greater than or equal to 1.

Parameters:
pageNo - [in] new page number.
Returns:
copy of the query with new parameter value.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when page number does not match the constraint.

public Query setLanguage(Lang langCode,
                         Region regionCode)
Defines new language value with language and country code.

Parameters:

regionCode - [in] country code to set.
Returns:
copy of the query with new parameter value.

getLanguage

public java.lang.String getLanguage()
Retrieves language as string value.

String format is two letters language code in lower case followed by hyphen followed by two letters country code in upper case. When no country has been defined, language code is only returned.

Examples: en-US, es.

Returns:
language.

getRawLanguage

public Language getRawLanguage()
Retrieves language as Google protobuf.

Returns:
language protobuf.

hasSort

public boolean hasSort()
Checks whether sort parameter has been set.

Returns:
true when sort parameter has been set, false otherwise.

setSort

public Query setSort(java.lang.String sortOrder)
Defines new sort order replacing existing one.

Sort order should match following regular expression: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_:]*(?:,(?:ASC|DESC))?(?:;[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_:]*(?:,(?:ASC|DESC))?)*.

Parameters:
sortOrder - [in] new sort order.
Returns:
copy of the query with new parameter value.

resetSort

public Query resetSort()
Reset sort parameter.

Returns:
copy of the query with new parameter value.

getSort

public java.lang.String getSort()
Retrieves sort parameter.

Returns:
sort parameter.
